Summary: Only venus shining in west, bright star like object moves slow from SE to overhead and stop and seems to be star.
trends: There have been 52 other sightings in Chandler
There were no other sightings in Chandler on or around June 2nd 2010
divs: Sighting DetailsI actually went out to look for UFO's after reading a Tucson report the other day. Tonight just after sunset Venus only star really visible...low in the west. A bright slow moving light on the eastern (and a bit south) horizon (about 15-20 degrees above horizon) moved west and north - toward my location. It traveled slowly - I can'tsay how fast but it took about 5 minutes to travel the distance. It took several minutes to arrive alomost completely over my head. It was too slow and high for a plane. And, planes don't stop overhead. It seemed to "pick" a location overhead...as though settling in or something..little wobbles of movement and then...bam, it doesn;t move again and it tracks with the stars! I tried to take video but it is too jumpy, best is I could pull stills and compare time stamp to location....definately will get a better tripod and not bother zooming in - too far away...just track it's motion..so hopefully. There is no realdefinition in the object but la bright light, it must be very high up. By 8:35 it was stopped for a few minutes and totally seemed like a star. I was hoping others might watch the sky towards Queen Creek..low around 8-20 till 8:30 pm and see if perhaps it is some kind of satellite... I left the camera on the whole time, so even though it is jumpy and hard to see travel I am pretty sure I didn't substitute a star for the moving object..as there were almost no other stars visible until a good 15 minutes after this began.... It was actually pretty weird and no one to see with me.
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
